meta.name: description
meta.content:
Castaic Union School District serves students and is located in Valencia, CA.
The Castaic Union School District, in partnership with the community, provides children with a creative and collaborative learning environment supported by a safe and nurturing atmosphere that creates life-long learners and empowers them to be critical thinkers in a global community.

li.a: Know a Child with Special Needs?

header.h2: Castaic Union School District Schools Closed for Remainder of the Year

div.p:
State health officials have made it clear that the safest place to be is home during the COVID-19 pandemic. With that in mind, our campuses will remain physically closed for the remainder of the school year. Our decision aligns with the recommendation from Los Angeles County Superintendent of Schools Dr. Debra Duardo that schools remain physically closed for the rest of the academic year. Please see the link to the press release from LACOE. https://www.lacoe.edu/Home/News-Announcements/ID/4422/Los-Angeles-County-schools-chief-recommends-campus-closures-through-the-end-of-the-academic-year-due-to-COVID-19.
Importantly, while campuses are closed, school is still in session and instruction will continue. We recognize that this decision comes with many challenges. Remote learning is a new experience for all of us. The California Department of Education, the Los Angeles County Office of Education and our leadership teams work each day to identify solutions to support this new learning environment.
We will continue to provide updates via email, school messenger, and text message. Our teachers and staff will continue to support safety, continuity of education and feeding our children in partnership with School Day Café. Please continue to follow us on social media for lunch distribution dates and times, Storytime with Mrs. Maxon, Virtual P.E. with Mrs. Z, and other resources.

div.style: position: absolute; overflow: hidden; left: 0px; top: 0px; width: 1850px; height: 800px;

div.div: This message is to inform you that the Castaic Union School District – in concert with the other Santa Clarita School Districts and the Los Angeles County Office of Education - will be closing all schools starting Monday, March 16 and extending through the remainder of the school year.

While campuses are closed, school is still in session and instruction will continue. We recognize that this decision comes with many challenges. Remote learning is a new experience for all of us. The California Department of Education, the Los Angeles County Office of Education and our leadership teams work each day to identify solutions to support this new learning environment.

We will continue to provide updates via email, school messenger, and text message. Our teachers and staff will continue to support safety, continuity of education and feeding our children in partnership with School Day Café. Please continue to follow us on social media for lunch distribution dates and times, Storytime with Mrs. Maxon, Virtual P.E. with Mrs. Z, and other resources.

video.alt: Video demonstrting use of electrostatic sprayer used to sanitize surfaces.

article.aria-label: Castaic Union School District Schools Closed for Remainder of the Year
article.a: Castaic Union School District Schools Closed for Remainder of the Year

h3.a: Castaic Union School District Schools Closed for Remainder of the Year

div.div:
State health officials have made it clear that the safest place to be is home during the COVID-19 pandemic. With that in mind, our campuses will remain physically closed for the remainder of the school year. Our decision aligns with the recommendation from Los Angeles County Superintendent of Schools Dr. Debra Duardo that schools remain physically closed for the rest of the academic year. Please see the link to the press release from LACOE. https://www.lacoe.edu/Home/News-Announcements/ID/4422/Los-Angeles-County-schools-chief-recommends-campus-closures-through-the-end-of-the-academic-year-due-to-COVID-19.
Importantly, while campuses are closed, school is still in session and instruction will continue. We recognize that this decision comes with many challenges. Remote learning is a new experience for all of us. The California Department of Education, the Los Angeles County Office of Education and our leadership teams work each day to identify solutions to support this new learning environment.
We will continue to provide updates via email, school messenger, and text message. Our teachers and staff will continue to support safety, continuity of education and feeding our children in partnership with School Day Café. Please continue to follow us on social media for lunch distribution dates and times, Storytime with Mrs. Maxon, Virtual P.E. with Mrs. Z, and other resources.

article.aria-label: All Students In Santa Clarita Under 18 Can Receive Free Meals While Schools Are Closed
article.a: All Students In Santa Clarita Under 18 Can Receive Free Meals While Schools Are Closed

h3.a: All Students In Santa Clarita Under 18 Can Receive Free Meals While Schools Are Closed

div.div: The Santa Clarita Valley School Food Services Agency is offering free meals for all children while schools are closed due to the coronavirus, officials said Tuesday.
